title: Liverpool hero Steven Gerrard clashes heads with Howard Webb over decision to award the free-kick Chelsea scored
text:

Steven Gerrard clashed heads with former Premier League referee Howard Webb over the free-kick that led to Chelsea taking the lead against Liverpool. 
The Reds legend was enraged by the decision to award the set piece, which David Luiz scored in sensational fashion, and made his voice heard on BT Sport. 
In the above video, Webb is asked discuss the controversial moment from the match and give his opinion on Mark Clattenburg's decision. 
But Gerrard gets in there first and explains exactly why he feels it was incorrect. Steven Gerrard was less than impressed with the decision to award the free-kick (Photo: BT Sport Football) Howard Webb takes Gerrard's argument on board but fights Clattenburg's corner (Photo: BT Sport) 
Fighting Liverpool's corner, the 36-year-old says: "I disagree with Mark's [Clattenburg] decision for two reasons. 
"One he miss-controls the ball, if that's in the penalty area you'd never get a penalty for it because he's miss-controlled it. So outside the box the rules have got to be the same. 
"The contact is minimal, and he leans into [Adam] Lallana, so there is no way in the world that's a free-kick." 
Webb takes Gerrard's argument on board, and agrees with him to some level, but defends the fact that Clattenburg's view of the challenge was obscured. David Luiz scored the resulting free-kick to put Chelsea 1-0 ahead (Photo: PA) Luiz celebrates scoring in Chelsea's Premier League clash with Liverpool (Photo: REUTERS) 
Gerrard continues: "Does he not take the touch into consideration? That it's gone ten yards in front of him, and he's drawn the foul. You said it yourself, he's drawn the foul, he was clever." 
Webb once again agrees with Gerrard to a point, and admits that when Clattenburg looks back on the challenge later he will likely concede that he got the decision wrong.
